# Melodic Scale in B (Mode: Lydian Dominant)

## Description
The Melodic scale in B, specifically in the Lydian Dominant mode, is a seven-note scale that starts on B and follows the intervals W-W-W-H-W-W-H, where W represents a whole step and H represents a half step. In this scale, the characteristic intervals are the augmented fourth (raised fourth degree) and the major seventh.

## Notes and Intervals
- B (Root)
- C# (Major 2nd)
- D# (Major 3rd)
- E# (Augmented 4th)
- F# (Perfect 5th)
- G# (Major 6th)
- A (Major 7th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Melodic scale in B, when used in the context of the Lydian Dominant mode, is often associated with genres like jazz, fusion, and some forms of rock music. This scale imparts a mysterious and exotic sound due to the augmented fourth and the major seventh intervals, adding tension and color to the music. It is commonly used to create an adventurous and dynamic musical flavor, perfect for solos and improvisation.
